title: Drawing, "Kaffeehaus"
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457e)
inscribed:
Upper right corner: 71
Upper right corner: caffeaus con quatro/ fontane che sibolzzano/ le quatro parti del Mondo (RB'45)
Alternate transcription on catalogue card.
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Center left: an elevation. The plan is like a spherical square with bevelled corners. In the center of the segments stands a fountain representing one of the four parts of the world. Flights of stairs lead up to the platform on which the building stands. Other fountains upon the landings. Circular rooms are to be connected by small ones. Fights of stairs lead to the portico.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Kaffeehaus".
Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1097.
